page.title: 13THE OLD & THE NEW-CHANGES
page.content: S.W. corner :{500090}Vast sweeping fields of oil-seed rape, wheat & potatoes cover most of this one square kilometre. Tucked away behind well- grown screens of mixed timber on the southern boundary lie two small holdings : Thrushes Bush & Little Bundish. Close-by to the west lies the only sports ground in the block. At present overgrown & neglected with broken goalposts; a silent testimony perhaps to changing tastes & interests of young country dwellers.THE JOHN BARLEYCORN :{501092}is popular inn with a small clientele of locals and a major motorist trade in the evenings & at weekends. An old building with a quaint interior of beams & nooks, it has adapted to changing needs, the cow-pond is now a lily-pond stocked with fish with an inviting garden as background.
